p: Another interesting aspect can be seen in Figure 42D, in which the hardness after cooling and ageing for pure Al0.6Mg0.8Si shows a maximum at the UCCR determined by DSC, and unlike all other alloys studied in this work, the hardness drops with faster cooling rates. Similar results have been reported for high-purity AlZnMg alloys [ 188]. It is possible that small quench-induced precipitates forming around the UCCR contribute a hardening effect.
